Chemical Engineer (CCR Operator) Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chemical Engineer (CCR Operator)

Job Location: Ibese Plant, Ogun

Key Duties and Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Monitor various sections of the production line from the Central Control Room (CCR) To ensure precision and adherence to standards in the cement production process.
	Provide relevant information and direction to patrollers and operators in the production line based on monitored operations in liaison with the shift coordination
	Assist in implementing DIL’S approved production
	Monitor and control all sections of the plant process lines to ensure stable equipment operation, employee safety and compliance with prescribe standards and environmental regulations
	Log in process data at specified intervals, documents and report operational activities accordingly.
	Ensure smooth operation of the crusher raw mills, kilns and cement mills by providing constant feedback and relevant guidance to shift coordinators, Engineers, Patrollers and Operators in the execution of the field work
	Inform patrollers, Attendants and operators of failures, potential failure or trouble spots and provide direction for problem solving.
	Diagnose and troubleshoot potential operating problems, either in consultation with shift coordinators, Engineers and the section Head or independently when immediate action is necessary to ensure production resumes
	Continuously review the plant automation system and make recommendations for improvement based on leading practises
	Prepare detailed reports on the work undertaken in a clear and concise manner
	Supervise casual staff to ensure all conveyor belts in the unit are clean and free from jamming
	Ensure cement and clinker production targets are achieved during the respective shift
	Perform any other duties assigned by the section Head /HOD


Key Requirements


	Holder of a BSc Degree in Chemical and Processing Engineering or any related discipline.
	At least 2 years of working experience in relevant position.

  "description": "Sunday Omojuyigbe &amp; Co. (Chartered Accountants) is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland/Festac, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities&nbsp;


	Oversee day-to-day business operations of the automobile workshop
	Coordinate vehicle repairs, maintenance and sales activities
	Supervise technicians, mechanics, and administrative staff
	Ensure efficient workflow, quality control, and timely job delivery
	Manage inventory of spare parts and tools
	Maintain accurate operational and administrative records
	Track basic cost per vehicle
	Liaise with customers and ensure high service standards
	Support management in business growth and cost control


Requirements


	BSc in discipline relating to Automobile Mech, Administration or Accounting.
	A male from (25-45years)
	Strong knowledge of automobiles
	Good administrative and organizational skills
	Ability to manage people and operations effectively
	Good communication and customer management skills
